Rationale.RP1_ImplementationReconstructability: The experiment can be fully reconstructed from plan.md and CodeWalkthrough.md. The plan explicitly specifies hypotheses, methodology (Pearson correlation with 0.5 excess correlation threshold), expected results (exact percentages: 1.26%, 4.16%, 1.23%), and data sources. No major guesswork was required.
Rationale.RP2_EnvironmentReproducibility: The environment was successfully reproduced. requirements.txt lists all dependencies (torch, transformer-lens, pandas, numpy). All packages installed without conflicts. Pre-computed dataframes loaded correctly. Model loading via transformer_lens worked. CUDA GPU was available and utilized.
Rationale.RP3_DeterminismAndStability: Results are deterministic and stable. Universal neuron percentages matched exactly across verification runs (1.26%, 4.16%, 1.23%). Statistical property comparisons yielded consistent results. Pre-computed correlation data ensures reproducibility.
Rationale.RP4_DemoPresentation: Not applicable. This repository provides full implementation code (correlations_fast.py, analysis/), pre-computed data, paper notebooks, and SLURM scripts. It is not demo-only and supports both verification and full replication.
